info.author: Andrew Wilkinson
classifiers: License :: OSI Approved :: GNU Library or Lesser General Public License (LGPL)
info.description:
Linda is an widely studied distributed computing environment, centred around
the notion of a tuple space. A tuple space is a bag (also called a multi-set) of
tuples. A tuple is an ordered, typed chunk of data. Tuple spaces exist
independently of processes in the system, and the data placed into a tuple space
also exist independently. See "Generative communication in Linda" (1985) and
"Multiple tuple spaces in Linda" both by David Gelernter for more information on
Linda.

PyLinda is a simple implementation of a linda system, however it also includes
several of the more recently proposed extensions to Linda in the form of multiple
tuple spaces, garbage collection, sane non-blocking primitives and bulk tuple
operations.
info.name: linda
info.summary: An implementation of the tuplespace based distributed computing system
info.html_description:
Linda is an widely studied distributed computing environment, centred around the notion of a tuple space. A tuple space is a bag (also called a multi-set) of tuples. A tuple is an ordered, typed chunk of data. Tuple spaces exist independently of processes in the system, and the data placed into a tuple space also exist independently. See “Generative communication in Linda” (1985) and “Multiple tuple spaces in Linda” both by David Gelernter for more information on Linda.

PyLinda is a simple implementation of a linda system, however it also includes several of the more recently proposed extensions to Linda in the form of multiple tuple spaces, garbage collection, sane non-blocking primitives and bulk tuple operations.
